Tomato___Early_blight.general: Early blight is caused by Alternaria solani. Remove infected leaves immediately. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb every 7-10 days. Ensure proper spacing between plants for good air circulation.
Tomato___Early_blight.prevention: Use disease-resistant varieties. Rotate crops annually. Water at the base of plants, avoid overhead watering. Mulch around plants to prevent soil splash. Remove plant debris at end of season.
Tomato___Early_blight.organic: Apply copper-based fungicides. Use neem oil spray. Apply compost tea to boost plant immunity. Practice crop rotation.

Tomato___Late_blight.general: Late blight is caused by Phytophthora infestans. Remove and destroy infected plants immediately. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil, mancozeb, or copper-based products. Treat every 5-7 days during wet weather.
Tomato___Late_blight.prevention: Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good drainage. Space plants properly. Avoid working in wet fields. Remove all plant debris after harvest.
Tomato___Late_blight.organic: Use copper-based fungicides. Apply baking soda solution (1 tsp per quart of water). Remove infected plants immediately.

Tomato___Leaf_Mold.general: Leaf mold is caused by Passalora fulva. Improve air circulation. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or maneb. Remove lower leaves to improve airflow.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.prevention: Use resistant varieties. Space plants properly. Water at base, not overhead. Maintain humidity below 85%. Use fans in greenhouses.
Tomato___Leaf_Mold.organic: Apply copper-based fungicides. Use neem oil. Improve ventilation.

Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.general: Septoria leaf spot is caused by Septoria lycopersici. Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or mancozeb every 7-10 days.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.prevention: Rotate crops. Avoid overhead watering. Space plants properly. Remove plant debris. Use mulch to prevent soil splash.
Tomato___Septoria_leaf_spot.organic: Apply copper-based fungicides. Use neem oil. Remove infected leaves promptly.

Tomato___Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider.general: Spider mites are tiny pests that suck plant sap. Apply miticides or insecticidal soap. Increase humidity. Remove heavily infested leaves.
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider.prevention: Keep plants well-watered. Increase humidity. Remove weeds. Introduce beneficial insects like ladybugs. Monitor regularly.
Tomato___Spider_mites_Two_spotted_spider.organic: Spray with neem oil or insecticidal soap. Use predatory mites. Apply diatomaceous earth. Increase humidity.

Tomato___Target_Spot.general: Target spot is caused by Corynespora cassiicola. Remove infected leaves. Apply fungicides containing chlorothalonil or azoxystrobin.
Tomato___Target_Spot.prevention: Use resistant varieties. Ensure good air circulation. Avoid overhead watering. Remove plant debris.
Tomato___Target_Spot.organic: Apply copper-based fungicides. Use neem oil. Improve ventilation.

Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.general: This is a viral disease spread by whiteflies. Remove and destroy infected plants. Control whitefly populations with insecticides.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.prevention: Use resistant varieties. Control whiteflies with yellow sticky traps. Use row covers. Remove weeds that host whiteflies.
Tomato___Tomato_Yellow_Leaf_Curl_Virus.organic: Use neem oil to control whiteflies. Introduce beneficial insects. Remove infected plants immediately.

Tomato___Bacterial_spot.general: Bacterial spot is caused by Xanthomonas species. Remove infected leaves. Apply copper-based bactericides. Avoid working in wet fields.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.prevention: Use disease-free seeds. Rotate crops. Avoid overhead watering. Space plants properly. Remove plant debris.
Tomato___Bacterial_spot.organic: Apply copper-based products. Use compost tea. Remove infected plant parts.

Tomato___Healthy.general: Your plant appears healthy! Continue good practices.
Tomato___Healthy.prevention: Maintain proper spacing, watering, and nutrition. Monitor regularly for pests and diseases.
Tomato___Healthy.organic: Continue organic practices: compost, proper spacing, and regular monitoring.

Potato___Early_blight.prevention: Use certified seed potatoes. Rotate crops. Ensure good drainage. Remove plant debris.
Potato___Early_blight.organic: Apply copper-based fungicides. Use compost tea. Practice crop rotation.

Potato___Late_blight.general: Late blight on potatoes is devastating. Remove and destroy infected plants immediately. Apply fungicides preventatively.
Potato___Late_blight.prevention: Use certified disease-free seed. Plant resistant varieties. Ensure good drainage. Monitor regularly.
Potato___Late_blight.organic: Apply copper-based fungicides. Remove infected plants immediately. Practice crop rotation.

Corn___maize___Northern_Leaf_Blight.general: Northern leaf blight is caused by Exserohilum turcicum. Apply fungicides containing azoxystrobin or propiconazole.
Corn___maize___Northern_Leaf_Blight.prevention: Use resistant varieties. Rotate crops. Remove crop residue. Ensure proper spacing.
Corn___maize___Northern_Leaf_Blight.organic: Apply copper-based fungicides. Practice crop rotation. Remove infected leaves.

Apple___Apple_scab.general: Apple scab is caused by Venturia inaequalis. Apply fungicides containing captan, mancozeb, or myclobutanil.
Apple___Apple_scab.prevention: Use resistant varieties. Prune for good air circulation. Remove fallen leaves. Apply preventive fungicides in spring.
Apple___Apple_scab.organic: Apply sulfur or lime-sulfur. Use resistant varieties. Remove infected leaves and fruit.

Apple___Black_rot.general: Black rot is caused by Botryosphaeria obtusa. Prune infected branches. Apply fungicides containing captan or thiophanate-methyl.
Apple___Black_rot.prevention: Prune properly. Remove mummified fruit. Ensure good air circulation. Apply preventive sprays.
Apple___Black_rot.organic: Apply copper-based fungicides. Prune infected parts. Remove debris.

Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.general: Cedar apple rust is caused by Gymnosporangium juniperi-virginianae. Apply fungicides containing myclobutanil or propiconazole.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.prevention: Remove nearby juniper trees if possible. Use resistant varieties. Apply preventive fungicides.
Apple___Cedar_apple_rust.organic: Apply sulfur-based fungicides. Remove alternate hosts if possible.
